channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Flight issues could linger after shutdown. And, Google's lawsuit targeting scammers
item.description: Even if the government shutdown ends this week, flight disruptions are expected to linger. And, Google has launched a lawsuit targeting text message scammers.
item.content:encoded:
Even if the government shutdown ends this week, flight disruptions are expected to linger. And, Google has launched a lawsuit targeting text message scammers.

(Image credit: Win McNamee)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: It's harder to get home insurance. That's changing communities across the U.S.
item.description: Home insurance is getting less affordable, and less available, as insurers raise prices and pull back from areas with extreme weather. That's forcing families across the country to make tough choices.
item.content:encoded:
Home insurance is getting less affordable, and less available, as insurers raise prices and pull back from areas with extreme weather. That's forcing families across the country to make tough choices.

(Image credit: Ryan Kellman)
item.dc:creator: Michael Copley

item.title: They found a 'bucket of lentils.' Then it blew up. The menace of Gaza's unexploded ordnance
item.description: The United Nations Mine Action Service estimates between 5% and 10% of Israeli weapons fired into Gaza in the past two years failed to detonate, and unexploded ordnance has killed at least 328 people.
item.content:encoded:
The United Nations Mine Action Service estimates between 5% and 10% of Israeli weapons fired into Gaza in the past two years failed to detonate, and unexploded ordnance has killed at least 328 people.

(Image credit: Anas Baba)
item.dc:creator: Rob Schmitz

item.title: The shutdown could be nearing its end, but high demand for food assistance lingers
item.description: The Capital Area Food Bank in Washington D.C., says it's allotted an extra 1 million meals for November, given the uncertainties about whether and when SNAP recipients will get their full benefits.
item.content:encoded:
The Capital Area Food Bank in Washington D.C., says it's allotted an extra 1 million meals for November, given the uncertainties about whether and when SNAP recipients will get their full benefits.

(Image credit: Mark Schiefelbein)
item.dc:creator: Ayana Archie

item.title: Adelita Grijalva is set to be sworn in, teeing up a potential vote on Epstein files
item.description: The Arizona Democrat won her race in September, but Speaker Mike Johnson has waited to swear her in until today. Grijalva has vowed to be the decisive signature in a bid to release the Epstein files.
item.content:encoded:
The Arizona Democrat won her race in September, but Speaker Mike Johnson has waited to swear her in until today. Grijalva has vowed to be the decisive signature in a bid to release the Epstein files.

(Image credit: Rebecca Noble)
item.dc:creator: Claudia Grisales

item.title: Here's how many strikes on alleged drug vessels the U.S. has announced
item.description: Since September, the Trump administration has carried out more than a dozen strikes on boats it claims are run by drug traffickers, killing more than 70 people.
item.content:encoded:
Since September, the Trump administration has carried out more than a dozen strikes on boats it claims are run by drug traffickers, killing more than 70 people.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Anusha Mathur

item.title: Google launches a lawsuit targeting text message scammers
item.description: Ever gotten a text saying you forgot to pay a nonexistent road toll or need to pick up a mystery package? Google's going after the scammers behind those messages.
item.content:encoded:
Ever gotten a text saying you forgot to pay a nonexistent road toll or need to pick up a mystery package? Google's going after the scammers behind those messages.

(Image credit: Justin Sullivan)
item.dc:creator: John Ruwitch

item.title: Once upon a time, nostalgia was epidemic among homesick soldiers
item.description: The word began as a medical diagnosis but over the centuries has evolved to mean the longing for a bygone, idealized past.
item.content:encoded:
The word began as a medical diagnosis but over the centuries has evolved to mean the longing for a bygone, idealized past.

(Image credit: George Walker IV)
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: On day 43 of the shutdown, a vote in the House could bring the impasse to an end
item.description: A vote in the House expected on Wednesday could end what is now the longest shutdown on record. Democrats are decrying the plan, saying it fails to address expiring health care subsidies.
item.content:encoded:
A vote in the House expected on Wednesday could end what is now the longest shutdown on record. Democrats are decrying the plan, saying it fails to address expiring health care subsidies.

(Image credit: Win McNamee)
item.dc:creator: Deirdre Walsh

item.title: 'Where do you want to go?': Six words that helped her start again
item.description: When Stacia was 21, she was struggling with severe depression. A stranger's simple question gave her safety during a time she needed it the most. Now, it's an example she's tried to follow ever since.
item.content:encoded:
When Stacia was 21, she was struggling with severe depression. A stranger's simple question gave her safety during a time she needed it the most. Now, it's an example she's tried to follow ever since.

(Image credit: Ryan Herron)
item.dc:creator: Laura Kwerel
